H0.text: The climate was once colder is inferred from the discovery of fossils of ocean shells on a mountain top.

H1.text: The shells were carried by the wind, which explains why a scientist found fossils of ocean shells on a mountain top.

H2.text: The mountain was covered by water, as indicated by a scientist finding fossils of ocean shells on its top.

H3.text: The shells once lived on dry land is a statement that can be made based on a scientist finding fossils of ocean shells on a mountain top.

A4.text: Another compounding factor was that fossils of apparently marine animals were found in parts of the world that were well above sea-level.

A5.text: The fossils available to Steno, da Vinci, and others mentioned above were primarily the easily-identifiable shells of marine animals
